intro: Brodiaea grandiflora var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf brodiaea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to California. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, making it a compact and ornamental addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This variety is valued for its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation in dry climates.
